intro: Scabiosa colchica, commonly known as the Armenian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a robust root system and sturdy stems. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Scabiosa colchica is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
